title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that KDM Bank’s liabilities will stay the same and/or does not explain that the transaction only affects the asset side of KDM Bank’s balance sheet by increasing KDM Bank’s reserves and decreasing KDM Bank’s holdings of bonds by the same amount, leaving the liabilities of KDM Bank unchanged.

The response states that KDM Bank’s liabilities will stay the same and explains that the transaction only affects the asset side of KDM Bank’s balance sheet by increasing KDM Bank’s reserves and decreasing KDM Bank’s holdings of bonds by the same amount, leaving the liabilities of KDM Bank unchanged.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that KDM Bank’s reserves will increase by $8,000 and/or does not explain that reserves will increase by the full amount of the bond purchase because KDM Bank traded bonds for cash or reserves (or because this transaction increases KDM Bank’s excess reserves which increases KDM Bank’s reserves; required reserves did not change).

The response states that KDM Bank’s reserves will increase by $8,000 and explains that reserves will increase by the full amount of the bond purchase because KDM Bank traded bonds for cash or reserves (or because this transaction increases KDM Bank’s excess reserves which increases KDM Bank’s reserves; required reserves did not change).

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the dollar value of the maximum amount of loans KDM Bank can make is $8,000 and/or does not explain that KDM Bank can lend out its excess reserves and the central bank’s purchase increased KDM Bank’s excess reserves by $8,000.

The response states that the dollar value of the maximum amount of loans KDM Bank can make is $8,000 and explains that KDM Bank can lend out its excess reserves and the central bank’s purchase increased KDM Bank’s excess reserves by $8,000.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the maximum amount by which the money supply can increase throughout the banking system as $160,000 and/or does not show the work.

Excess Reserves×Money Multiplier=$8,000× 1 0.05 =$160,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6B97@

The response calculates the maximum amount by which the money supply can increase throughout the banking system as $160,000 and shows the work.

Excess Reserves×Money Multiplier=$8,000× 1 0.05 =$160,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6B97@

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that consumption spending and real GDP will increase and/or does not explain that the increase in the money supply decreases nominal interest rates and increases interest-sensitive spending, including consumption, thus increasing aggregate demand and real GDP.

The response states that consumption spending and real GDP will increase and explains that the increase in the money supply decreases nominal interest rates and increases interest-sensitive spending, including consumption, thus increasing aggregate demand and real GDP.
